sense.name: undertake, engage in
sense.examples: We contracted to have them paint just the exterior of the building. They have contracted a new pitcher for next season. The firm has contracted out the Bernulli project.

sense.name: compact, shrink, reduce
sense.examples: The body builder contracted his biceps to display his muscles. Wash that fabric before you sew with it, to gauge how much it will contract. The heat caused the wood to contract and split.

sense.name: condense, constrict
sense.examples: She had to contract her two-week vacation into a long weekend. They will be contracting the large pool of applicants down to three finalists. He contracted his business plan into a concise, 5-page document.

sense.name: sicken
sense.examples: He contracted malaria in Madagascar. The dog contracted kennel cough at the animal shelter.

sense.name: consent/refuse to pay money to a trade union for political use
sense.commentary: Includes: CONTRACT IN, CONTRACT OUT NOTE: 'contract in' is 'consent to pay' and 'contract out' is 'refuse to pay'.
sense.examples: If you contract in, the additional state pension assumes everyone is married. If you contract out via a personal pension, you will enjoy a slightly higher rebate.
